segment.source: Administrative templates and Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Administrative templates and Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Administrative templates and Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Administrative templates and Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Administrative templates and Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Administrative templates and Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Administrative Templates are made up of a hierarchy of policy categories and subcategories that define how your policy settings appear in the Local Group Policy Editor, including:
segment.target: Administrative Templates are made up of a hierarchy of policy categories and subcategories that define how your policy settings appear in the Local Group Policy Editor, including:

segment.source: What registry locations correspond to each setting.
segment.target: What registry locations correspond to each setting.

segment.source: What value options or restrictions are associated with each setting.
segment.target: What value options or restrictions are associated with each setting.

segment.source: The default value for many settings.
segment.target: The default value for many settings.

segment.source: Text explanations about each setting and the supported version of Internet Explorer.
segment.target: Text explanations about each setting and the supported version of Internet Explorer.

segment.source: For a conceptual overview of Administrative Templates, see Managing Group Policy ADMX Files Step-by-Step Guide.
segment.target: For a conceptual overview of Administrative Templates, see Managing Group Policy ADMX Files Step-by-Step Guide.

segment.source: What are Administrative Templates?
segment.target: What are Administrative Templates?

segment.source: Administrative Templates are XML-based, multi-language files that define the registry-based Group Policy settings in the Local Group Policy Editor.
segment.target: Administrative Templates are XML-based, multi-language files that define the registry-based Group Policy settings in the Local Group Policy Editor.

segment.source: There are two types of Administrative Templates:
segment.target: There are two types of Administrative Templates:

segment.source: ADMX.
segment.target: ADMX.

segment.source: A language-neutral setup file that states the number and type of policy setting, and the location by category, as it shows up in the Local Group Policy Editor.
segment.target: A language-neutral setup file that states the number and type of policy setting, and the location by category, as it shows up in the Local Group Policy Editor.

segment.source: ADML.
segment.target: ADML.

segment.source: A language-specific setup file that provides language-related information to the ADMX file.
segment.target: A language-specific setup file that provides language-related information to the ADMX file.

segment.source: This file lets the policy setting show up in the right language in the Local Group Policy Editor.
segment.target: This file lets the policy setting show up in the right language in the Local Group Policy Editor.

segment.source: You can add new languages by adding new ADML files in the required language.
segment.target: You can add new languages by adding new ADML files in the required language.

segment.source: How do I store Administrative Templates?
segment.target: How do I store Administrative Templates?

segment.source: As an admin, you can create a central store folder on your SYSVOL directory, named PolicyDefinitions.
segment.target: As an admin, you can create a central store folder on your SYSVOL directory, named PolicyDefinitions.

segment.source: For example, %SystemRootPolicyDefinitions.
segment.target: For example, %SystemRootPolicyDefinitions.

segment.source: This folder provides a single, centralized storage location for your Administrative Templates (both ADMX and ADML) files, so they can be used by your domain-based Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
segment.target: This folder provides a single, centralized storage location for your Administrative Templates (both ADMX and ADML) files, so they can be used by your domain-based Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Your Group Policy tools use the ADMX files in your store, ignoring any local copies.
segment.target: Your Group Policy tools use the ADMX files in your store, ignoring any local copies.

segment.source: For more information about creating a central store, see Scenario 1: Editing the Local GPO Using ADMX Files.
segment.target: For more information about creating a central store, see Scenario 1: Editing the Local GPO Using ADMX Files.

segment.source: Administrative Templates-related Group Policy settings
segment.target: Administrative Templates-related Group Policy settings

segment.source: When you install Internet Explorer 11, it updates the local administrative files, Inetres.admx and Inetres.adml, both located in the PolicyDefinitions folder.
segment.target: When you install Internet Explorer 11, it updates the local administrative files, Inetres.admx and Inetres.adml, both located in the PolicyDefinitions folder.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You won't see the new policy settings if you try to view or edit your policy settings on a computer that isn't running IE11.
segment.target: You won't see the new policy settings if you try to view or edit your policy settings on a computer that isn't running IE11.

segment.source: To fix this, you can either install IE11, or you can copy the updated Inetres.admx and Inetres.adml files from another computer to the PolicyDefinitions folder on this computer.
segment.target: To fix this, you can either install IE11, or you can copy the updated Inetres.admx and Inetres.adml files from another computer to the PolicyDefinitions folder on this computer.

segment.source: IE11 provides these new policy settings, which are editable in the Local Group Policy Editor, and appear in the following policy paths:
segment.target: IE11 provides these new policy settings, which are editable in the Local Group Policy Editor, and appear in the following policy paths:

segment.target: Computer ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows Components

segment.target: User ConfigurationAdministrative TemplatesWindows Components

segment.source: Catalog
segment.target: Catalog

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: IE
segment.target: IE

segment.source: Turns standard IE configuration on and off.
segment.target: Turns standard IE configuration on and off.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Accelerators
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Accelerators

segment.source: Sets up and manages Accelerators.
segment.target: Sets up and manages Accelerators.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Administrator Approved Controls
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Administrator Approved Controls

segment.source: Turns ActiveX controls on and off.
segment.target: Turns ActiveX controls on and off.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Application Compatibility
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Application Compatibility

segment.source: Turns the Cut, Copy, or Paste operations on or off.
segment.target: Turns the Cut, Copy, or Paste operations on or off.

segment.source: This setting also requires that is set to Prompt.
segment.target: This setting also requires that is set to Prompt.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Browser Menus
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Browser Menus

segment.source: Shows or hides the IE menus and menu options.
segment.target: Shows or hides the IE menus and menu options.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Corporate Settings
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Corporate Settings

segment.source: Turns off whether you specify the code download path for each computer.
segment.target: Turns off whether you specify the code download path for each computer.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Delete Browsing History
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Delete Browsing History

segment.source: Turns the Delete Browsing History settings on and off.
segment.target: Turns the Delete Browsing History settings on and off.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel

segment.source: Turns pages on and off in the Internet Options dialog box.
segment.target: Turns pages on and off in the Internet Options dialog box.

segment.source: Also turns on and off the subcategories that manage settings on the Content, General, Security and Advanced pages.
segment.target: Also turns on and off the subcategories that manage settings on the Content, General, Security and Advanced pages.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Internet Settings
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Internet Settings

segment.source: Sets up and manages the Advanced settings, AutoComplete, Display Settings, and URL Encoding options.
segment.target: Sets up and manages the Advanced settings, AutoComplete, Display Settings, and URL Encoding options.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Persistence Behavior
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Persistence Behavior

segment.source: Sets up and manages the file size limits for Internet security zones.
segment.target: Sets up and manages the file size limits for Internet security zones.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Privacy
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Privacy

segment.source: Turns various privacy-related features on and off.
segment.target: Turns various privacy-related features on and off.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Security Features
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Security Features

segment.source: Turns various security-related features on and off in the browser, Windows Explorer, and other applications.
segment.target: Turns various security-related features on and off in the browser, Windows Explorer, and other applications.

segment.source: Internet Explorer\Toolbars
segment.target: Internet Explorer\Toolbars

segment.source: Turns on and off the ability for users to edit toolbars in the browser.
segment.target: Turns on and off the ability for users to edit toolbars in the browser.

segment.source: You can also set the default toolbar buttons here.
segment.target: You can also set the default toolbar buttons here.

segment.source: RSS Feeds
segment.target: RSS Feeds

segment.source: Sets up and manages RSS feeds in the browser.
segment.target: Sets up and manages RSS feeds in the browser.

segment.source: Editing Group Policy settings
segment.target: Editing Group Policy settings

segment.source: Regardless which tool you're using to edit your Group Policy settings, you'll need to follow one of these guides for step-by-step editing instructions:
segment.target: Regardless which tool you're using to edit your Group Policy settings, you'll need to follow one of these guides for step-by-step editing instructions:

segment.source: If you're using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Local Group Policy Editor.
segment.target: If you're using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or the Local Group Policy Editor.

segment.source: See Edit Administrative Template Policy Settings for step-by-step instructions about editing your Administrative Templates.
segment.target: See Edit Administrative Template Policy Settings for step-by-step instructions about editing your Administrative Templates.

segment.source: If you're using GPMC with Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM).
segment.target: If you're using GPMC with Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM).

segment.source: See Checklist: Create, Edit, and Deploy a GPO for step-by-step instructions about how to check out a GPO from the AGPM archive, edit it, and request deployment.
segment.target: See Checklist: Create, Edit, and Deploy a GPO for step-by-step instructions about how to check out a GPO from the AGPM archive, edit it, and request deployment.
